alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Isle of Wight; James City; Surry (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 4:03PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Charles City, northwestern Isle of Wight, Surry and southwestern James City Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 402 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near College Of William And Mary to Surry to near Elberon. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Claremont, Surry, Dendron, Scotland, Rustic, Elberon, Cabin Point, Rushmere, Carsley, Pons, Chippokes State Park, Spring Grove, Ellis Fork, Poolesville, Gwaltney Corner, Hog Island Game Reserve, Oak Hill Corner, Alliance and Runnymede. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Isle of Wight; James City; Surry
